Setting File Options

The Personal Options feature allows you to choose a variety of options to customize the way you work with files. In a few cases (such as Marking Unlocked Files Read Only), your administrator's choices may override your preferences.

The application offers many file options, including the following:

  • Controlling the time stamp for checked-out files.

  • Using file checksums to determine status.

  • Making unlocked files read-only.

  • Speeding up check-outs by allowing the server to send only the delta between the working file and the requested revision.

  • Automatically checking in merged files.

  • Selecting an editor other than Notepad.

To select file options:

  1. Select Tools > Personal Options from the menu bar. The Personal Options dialog opens.

  2. Select the File tab.

  3. Select either or both of the Check-out options:

    • Select the Use last modification time for checked-out files check box so that the time for each checked out file is the same as the time stamp of the revision being checked out. Otherwise, the time stamp used for the checked-out file is the current time – that is, the time the check-out occurs.

    • Select the Optimize for slow connections check box so that when you check out a file, the application server sends only the delta (difference between the revision in the working folder and the revision being checked out) if this speeds up the data transfer. When this box is cleared, the server always sends the entire revision of the file.

  4. Select one of the Merging options:

    • Select Always pop up Visual Merge to view the merged file, even when no conflicts are found.

    • Select Pop up Visual Merge in case of conflicts only to view the merged file only if it contains conflicts. Otherwise, files will be checked in and out automatically.

  5. Select any of the Locking options:

    • Select Exclusively lock files on check-out so that the Check Out dialog lock status option defaults to Exclusive. (Otherwise, the default is Keep current.)

    • Select Clear file locks on check-in so that the Check In dialog’s lock status defaults to Unlock. (Otherwise, the default is Keep current.)

    • Select the Use non-exclusive locks in integrations check box to affect how files are locked when accessed from application integrations. When you select this check box, locking a file creates a non-exclusive lock – that is, a lock that allows others to check in the file. Using non-exclusive locks also allows more than one person to edit a file at one time. If team members are not editing the same lines of the file, the merged file usually has no conflicts.

    • Select the Mark unlocked working files read-only check box to have working copies of files that you have not locked become read-only when you add files, check in files, check out files, or unlock files. If this check box is selected, only locked files can be edited.

  6. Select either or both of the General options (Windows client only):

    • Select the Use file checksums (MD5) to calculate status check box to use the checksum instead of the file time stamp and size to compute the Status field when the application is refreshed. Using the checksum provides a more accurate status value than the time stamp, but takes longer. Clear the check box to use the time stamp and size.

    • Select Automatically detect changes to working files (the default), if you want the application to do this. If you do not select this option, it will not show changes to files in your working folders.

  7. Select EOL options (Cross-Platform client only):

    • Select or clear Automatic EOL conversion (CR-LF) on add/check-in.

    • Select or clear Automatic EOL conversion on check-out.

    • If you select either of the EOL options, also specify whether you are working on Windows, Unix, or Mac by clicking the appropriate button.

  8.  (Cross-Platform client only) Set the default code page to be used for keyword expansion by selecting a Default file encoding from the drop-down list box.

  9. Select from the Repository options:

    • Select Central or Per folder to indicate where you want file status information stored.

    • If you select Central, you can enter or browse for a location other than the default Central repository location. For more information, see Storing File Status Information.

  10. Select from the URL options:

    • To use a special template to generate display text for URLs of this type, enter its name in the Display Template field. For more information on templates, see the StarTeam User's Guide.

    • Select or clear Generate ID-based URLs. When this option is selected, the URL will be specified by ID rather than by name. For example, an ID-based URL would be starteam://hostname:49201/12;ns=Project;scheme=id, while a name-based URL would be starteam://hostname:49201/myproject.

  11. (Optional) If you do not want to use the default editor and editors for the application, select the Alternative applications button. This action displays the StarTeam Alternate Applications dialog.

    • Select the Editor check box to use an alternative editor. Browse to enter the correct location for the editor. To return to using Notepad, clear the check box.

    • Select the Merge utility to use a different merge utility. Browse to enter the correct location for the utility. To return to using Visual Merge, clear the check box.

    • Select the Comparison utility to use a different comparison utility. Browse to enter the correct location for the utility. To return to using Visual Diff, clear the check box.

      • Note: It is optional but desirable to enter the command line options used with the utility in the Options text box.

  12. Click OK to return to the File dialog.

  13. Click OK to save your file preferences, and close the Personal Options dialog.
